topics.body:
This is a fun little question I was asked. 

A man stays on under a lamp post for 5 days straight. He eats there, sleeps there and also does his prime needs there. Has he changed positions?
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
Hey, look:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VblazNXcHFg
Robots helping fight malaria.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c03706368726c6fa00500#post_538c03706368726c6fa00500

id answer no, but its probably some kind of trick like "lololo, the lamp its actually an alien that carries him"
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c045e6368726a227c0500#post_538c045e6368726a227c0500

Kind of. The answer is "No. The man did changed positions because time and space never stay the same. The man wasn't on the same spot he was standing now because the entire solar system is traveling across the Universe and 5 hours had passed since then. His starting position had changed after the first second but he only felt time had changed. We only have a concept of time, but we tend to take the space for granted"

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c07be6368720c885f0000#post_538c07be6368720c885f0000
Let that person be me then. I am on the fence about vaccines because while the general concept is good the execution can be bad. Vaccines are produced by several pharmaceutical companies and some are far safer and better than others. I am not against vaccines, I am against inferior vaccines that can and have caused illness and terrible side effects. This vaccine however seems to be wonderful, based on the video it has shown 100% effectiveness in human trials so far and if it provides long term protection with little to no side effects I will embrace and covet it's use by everyone who needs it.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c08ef6368720cebc20000#post_538c08ef6368720cebc20000
That makes no sense. Why try to reinvent the wheel? We already have a Hep B vaccine. The only advantage to this is the ease of production and distribution. I think it's actually pretty cool that a vaccine could literally grow on trees but the amount invested in the I think could otherwise just to go to figuring out how to produce the existing vaccine at a lower cost or at the very least just using that money to simply make more of the vaccines.

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c0aa96368720f53f10000#post_538c0aa96368720f53f10000
Yeah; I prefer to speak in non-technical terms for describing things cause I feel as though it makes people far more willing to debate something.

As much as I dislike when people are against vaccines I still feel as though they're entitled to their opinions and thus you should speak to them in a manner everyone can understand.  It's why you'll never see me speak in technical terms when it comes to say astrophysics or such cause sure there's people that still believe there's no such thing as other planets or people that believe the sun revolves around the earth, but they're still entitled to their opinions and thus it's best to debate people in a manner most people can understand; or for example when I debate economics and why communism, reagonism and so forth are wrong and why hybrid economics are the best; I could talk in technical terms, but I feel as though it makes people far more willing to listen if you try to make your point understood. . . and no I before anyone asks no I am not a physicist/economist or so forth; the only thing I'm a professional in is advertising and I'm learning programming now.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
